title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics' three-game winning streak ended with a 128-101 loss to the Houston Rockets.
Kevin Durant led the Rockets with 26 points, contributing to their dominant performance against an exhausted Celtics team.
Baylor Scheierman led the Celtics with 17 points, showing improvement in recent games despite the team's loss.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate D'Ernest Johnson to the active roster after Rhamondre Stevenson is sidelined with a toe injury.
Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, could debut against the Falcons and contribute on offense and special teams.
New England's depth at running back has diminished with injuries to Antonio Gibson and Rhamondre Stevenson.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov form a new defensive partnership improving Boston Bruins' performance in recent games.
The Zadorov-McAvoy pairing allowed only one 5-on-5 goal over 73:24 minutes, significantly tightening the defense.
Hampus Lindholm's return aids Bruins, combining with rookie Jonathan Aspirot for a stronger defensive line-up.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed only one goal, leading the Bruins to a 2-1 victory over the Carolina Hurricanes.
Joonas Korpisalo started consecutive games for the Bruins after Swayman's 7-2 loss against Ottawa.
Coach Marco Sturm praised the goalie depth, hinting at balanced starts for Swayman and Korpisalo moving forward.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox's free agency begins as key players like Alex Bregman and Dustin May are set to become free agents.
Lucas Giolito has a $19 million mutual option while Trevor Story can opt out for additional compensation from Boston.
With a $218.92 million payroll, the Red Sox have $25 million before hitting the luxury tax, exploring rotation and infield upgrades.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty will call his third Patriots game this regular season with CBS, having also covered preseason games.
McCourty expressed surprise at the Patriots' improvement, especially quarterback Drake Maye's MVP-level performances.
Drake Maye's standout game was against the Titans with 21 of 23 passes for 222 yards and two touchdowns.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are reportedly interested in trading for Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips before the NFL trade deadline.
Phillips, 26, has logged three sacks in the last month and ranks 11th in pressures among edge rushers.
The Dolphins, struggling at 2-7, may trade Phillips, who is in the final year of his rookie contract.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei has been benched for three consecutive Bruins games due to Boston's recent winning streak and depth chart changes.
Coach Marco Sturm believes Lohrei should feel frustrated and use time off for learning, despite his offensive contributions.
The Bruins have improved defensively, conceding fewer goals with Nikita Zadorov as Charlie McAvoy's partner instead of Lohrei.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Falcons have a 3-4 record and face the Patriots in Week 9 of NFL season.
Running back Bijan Robinson leads the NFL in scrimmage yards, with 137.4 yards per game this season.
The Falcons' defense ranks second in yards allowed, strong in pass defense with standout cornerback A.J. Terrell.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts hit a two-run single in the third inning, giving the Dodgers a 3-0 lead over the Blue Jays.
Kiké Hernandez secured the Dodgers' win by doubling off a runner at second base in the final inning of Game 6.
Betts ended his World Series slump with the crucial hit, while Hernandez's awareness prevented a Blue Jays comeback.
